title: Someone to Stay
review: My favourite song so far in my life. The acoustic version is much more beutiful with the harmonies.

title: you broke me first
review: First Tate McRae song I listened to. I don't think songs can get more sadder than this one.

title: Punkrocker
review: Listened to this first in the Superman movie. A great song to lift the spirits and inspire.

title: About You
review: The 1975 nails the dream pop genre with this song. The best rendition of star-crossed lovers in music history in my opinion. Favourite lyrics being [[highlight:'Hold on and hope that we'll find our way back in the end']]. I still can't go on a train ride without this song playing in the back of my head.

title: Close To You
review: Started listening to this during the April 2024. The song exactly matches the events happened in my life during that time, especially at the Prom night with the lyrics saying [[highlight:'smoky dark crowded room I need nothing, under pink light in june']],

title: I Wanna Be Yours
review: Top-notch soft rock song to slow dance to.

title: Heavy
review: Dream pop song great for slow dancing and to listen on a train ride. Listened to this song greatly while I first moved to Sydney.

title: Strawberries and Cigarettes
review: Good beat and you can almost feel the aesthetics of this song (although I haven't smoked ever in my life)

title: City of Angels
review: Good song to listen when you want to start again.
